org.treetank.access

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.treetank.access.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDatabase

    public final class Database
extends Object
implements IDatabase
    This class represents one concrete database for enabling several ISession objects.
    Author:
    Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz
    See Also:
    IDatabase

    • Method Detail

      • createDatabase

        public static boolean createDatabase(DatabaseConfiguration pDBConfig)
                              throws TTIOException
        Creating a database. This includes loading the database configuration, building up the structure and preparing everything for login.
        Parameters:
        pDBConfig - which are used for the database, including storage location
        Returns:
        true if creation is valid, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTIOException - if something odd happens within the creation process.

      • truncateDatabase

        public static void truncateDatabase(DatabaseConfiguration pConf)
                             throws TTException
        Truncate a database. This deletes all relevant data. All running sessions must be closed beforehand.
        Parameters:
        pConf - the database at this path should be deleted.
        Throws:
        TTException - any kind of false Treetank behaviour

      • existsDatabase

        public static boolean existsDatabase(File pStoragePath)
        Check if Database exists or not at a given path.
        Parameters:
        pStoragePath - to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if existing, false otherwise.

      • createResource

        public boolean createResource(ResourceConfiguration pResConf)
                       throws TTIOException
        Creation of a resource. Since databases can consist out of several resources, those can be created within this method. This includes the creation of a suitable folder structure as well as the serialization of the configuration of this resource.
        Specified by:
        createResource in interface IDatabase
        Parameters:
        pResConf - the config of the resource
        Returns:
        boolean with true if successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTIOException - if anything happens while creating the resource

      • truncateResource

        public void truncateResource(String pResConf)
        Truncating a resource. This includes the removal of all data stored within this resource.
        Specified by:
        truncateResource in interface IDatabase
        Parameters:
        pResConf - storing the name of the resource

      • openDatabase

        public static IDatabase openDatabase(File pFile)
                              throws TTException
        Open database. A database can be opened only once. Afterwards the singleton instance bound to the File is given back.
        Parameters:
        pFile - where the database is located sessionConf a SessionConfiguration object to set up the session
        Returns:
        IDatabase instance.
        Throws:
        TTException - if something odd happens

      • getSession

        public ISession getSession(SessionConfiguration pSessionConf)
                    throws TTException
        Getting the session associated within this database.
        Specified by:
        getSession in interface IDatabase
        Parameters:
        pSessionConf - SessionConfiguration.Builder reference
        Returns:
        the session
        Throws:
        TTException - if can't get session

        public void close()
           throws TTException
        Closing the database for further access.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IDatabase
        Throws:
        TTException - if anything happens within treetank.

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • removeSession

        protected boolean removeSession(File pFile)
        Closing a resource. This callback is necessary due to centralized handling of all sessions within a database.
        Parameters:
        pFile - to be closed
        Returns:
        true if close successful, false otherwise

        Returns:
